text:
IDK if you had another way to get keycloak to make the service account user UUID, but I just did it this way:
```
NS="your-ns"

VALIDATOR_CLIENT_ID="validator-backend"
VALIDATOR_CLIENT_SECRET="<validator client secret from keycloak>"
WALLET_UI_CLIENT_ID="wallet-ui"
CNS_UI_CLIENT_ID="cns-ui"
OIDC_AUTHORITY_URL="https://<your dns>/realms/<your realm name>"
OIDC_AUTHORITY_LEDGER_API_AUDIENCE="<https://canton.network.global>"
OIDC_AUTHORITY_LEDGER_API_SCOPE="daml_ledger_api"


kubectl create --namespace ${NS} secret generic splice-app-wallet-ui-auth \
    "--from-literal=url=${OIDC_AUTHORITY_URL}" \
    "--from-literal=client-id=${WALLET_UI_CLIENT_ID}"

kubectl create --namespace ${NS} secret generic splice-app-cns-ui-auth \
    "--from-literal=url=${OIDC_AUTHORITY_URL}" \
    "--from-literal=client-id=${CNS_UI_CLIENT_ID}"

kubectl create --namespace ${NS} secret generic splice-app-validator-ledger-api-auth \
    "--from-literal=ledger-api-user=${VALIDATOR_CLIENT_ID}" \
    "--from-literal=url=${OIDC_AUTHORITY_URL}/.well-known/openid-configuration" \
    "--from-literal=client-id=${VALIDATOR_CLIENT_ID}" \
    "--from-literal=client-secret=${VALIDATOR_CLIENT_SECRET}" \
    "--from-literal=audience=${OIDC_AUTHORITY_LEDGER_API_AUDIENCE}"

# run the deploy for the validator + participant, get the value from keycloak for the service account user's UUID, then recreate the k8s secret to change the ledger-api-user

kubectl --namespace ${NS} delete secret splice-app-validator-ledger-api-auth

VALIDATOR_SERVICE_USER_ID="<value from keycloak UI for validator api service account UUID>"
# note the difference on the ledger-api-user and client-id (different than auth0)
kubectl create --namespace ${NS} secret generic splice-app-validator-ledger-api-auth \
    "--from-literal=ledger-api-user=${VALIDATOR_SERVICE_USER_ID}" \
    "--from-literal=url=${OIDC_AUTHORITY_URL}/.well-known/openid-configuration" \
    "--from-literal=client-id=${VALIDATOR_CLIENT_ID}" \
    "--from-literal=client-secret=${VALIDATOR_CLIENT_SECRET}" \
    "--from-literal=audience=${OIDC_AUTHORITY_LEDGER_API_AUDIENCE}"```
can add this in the comments also, wasn't sure if there was a more programmatic way to get keycloak to give the UUID for that service account

VALIDATOR_SERVICE_USER_ID="<value from keycloak UI for validator api service account UUID>"

text: yep -- thats the one! not sure if there's a way to get keycloak to generate that UUID without the service account logging in first, but if you put that as the value for `"--from-literal=ledger-api-user=${VALIDATOR_SERVICE_USER_ID}"` in the creds it'll stop crashing. not sure if the validator throwing an exception there is a bug or a feature
